body.name: Peak Design Leash Camera Strap (L-BL-3)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 9 mins
Or fastest pickup Tuesday, February 13. Order within 9 mins
features: Light, quick-release camera strap that fits in your pocket and carries over 200 lbs (90kg) of gear.
Universal compatibility with all cameras, including CANON, NIKON, SONY, FUJI, and other systems.
Smooth seatbelt-style webbing glides over clothing for fast camera access and all-day comfort.
Quickly shorten and lengthen using dual aluminum/Hypalon quick-adjusters. Range: 33 to 57 inches.
Connect Leash to binoculars, rangefinders, tripods, tools, firearms, and more.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.8 4.8 out of 5 stars 3,214 ratings 4.8 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love This Strap
reviews.reviewText: First off, everything about PD products is top notch. This strap is no different. The thin sleek design is a positive and prevents fighting the strap when shooting between landscape and portrait camera positions. Another big plus for me is the length of the strap. I’m a tall guy and I really dislike straps that render the camera hanging on my lower chest or belly area. This one allows the camera to hang at my waist / hip area - just where I want it. Along with the interchangeability across several cameras by using the small attachment tabs (unique to PD straps), this strap is a winner. I have three of these straps now and use them across numerous cameras.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Well designed, comfortable & adaptable
reviews.reviewText: This product has been around a while, but this strap system is still one of the best for comfort and adaptability. I use the strap in two ways:1) Latched on to the camera case in a traditional shoulder strap configuration.2) To carry the camera itself, from its tripod mount when camera fitted with a larger telephote lens. This way the lens does not bounce around when walking, yet the camera is very easy to instantly access for shooting.Definitely recommended, especially for the latter use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for the smallest of cameras
reviews.reviewText: I carry a Sony a7cr with a 40 2.5 G. And small compact setup that’s very light. This is perfect for that. If I add a heavier lens such as a 70-200, this strap may be too thin for the weight and it may cut into your should some. I got it for the light setup though. A heavier one, and I’d opp for one of the other Peak Design wider straps.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth Every Cent
reviews.reviewText: I was reluctant to spend the money for this product. I read the reviews and trusted the info folks posted about their satisfaction with the strap. I'm glad I did.The quality of the strap is very good, and I don't think I could have chosen a better strap as far as comfort. I'm using it on a small frame Canon though (GX7 iii) so the weight was already not an issue. What I found was wearing the strap for hours a day while traveling and touring was just like putting on another piece of clothing. I often kept the camera and strap hanging inside a shirt. Easy enough to grab the strap and pull up the camera when it was time to take a shot.I found the thickness of the connecting loop from the quick-connect piece was good quality but was too think to feed through the narrow Canon attachment points at the sides of the camera's body. The attachment plate for the bottom of the camera was excellent; however for this model of camera which burns through batteries, loosening the plate to change batteries became inconvenient. I attached a thinner, small piece of strong material to the attachment point on the left side of the camera and then attached the Peak Design quick-connect pieces to this added loop. Worked fine. The trick is finding a good, strong piece of material to attack to the camera.Anyways, glad I spent the money and I understand now why others have given this product high ratings.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars I just discovered you can iron these straps!!
reviews.reviewText: I have the old leash strap and I love it. In fact, I love all of the old versions of Peak Design products better than the newer replacements. But I needed another strap and wanted to go as minimal as I could.This Leash strap is pretty good, but the strap is thicker than the old one, meaning it's more stiff. Also, the way they package these straps into the box, they have annoying creases in them. However, I had an idea that maybe I could use an iron on low setting to get them straight, so I googled it and found that I could.I would recommend to use a LOW heat setting, and only turn it up as needed (it doesn't take much heat to do the job). I'm sure if you go too hot, you will melt the strap. So just keep that in mind. But now that I have completely removed any kinks in the straps, I like them much more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Love this strap - strong enough for my Nikon z7, z8 and z9 - does not encumber fast shooting

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Camera Strap
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Peak Design Leash camera strap. They’re comfortable, strong and the easy release allows the strap to be used for several different cameras, cases and packs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Pricey, but great quality
reviews.reviewText: This is my second Peak Design strap, this one purchased for my Canon R100 camera.I don't keep a strap on my cameras 100% of the time, so a good quick-release is key for me.I like the way peak does the release, it's solid when connected and fairly unobtrusive when disconnected.The quality of the construction seems to be top-notch, time will tell. But for a smaller bodied camera like the R100, The Leash is the perfect size.

Probably like most, I saw all the straps for half the price of this one. I’ve even owned third party straps for cameras way cheaper than this, but trust me. This ones different.The attention to detail is profound, just the material used both the strap itself and the metal components.Even the quick release plastic parts feel polished and smoothed around the corners, no sharp jagged bits to just tip you over into a bad mood when your having one of those days!Peak Design have undoubtedly obsessed over the manufacturing process and I sincerely appreciate it.Just a darn good strap that feels like it’s gonna last a lifetime.

reviews.reviewerName: Francisco Javier peña ValenzuelaFrancisco Javier peña Valenzuela
reviews.reviewText: Maravillosas, me las recomendaron muchisimo, estaba en duda si irme por la gruesa o la delgada, pero la verdad la delgada no le pide nada a su otra versión, es muy resistenta y bastante comoda, cabe incluso mas en el bolsillo en dado caso de tener que retirarla rapidamente y guardarla para alguna ocasión.La versad muy buena, me llegó muy rapido, en menos de 24 horas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Qualité du produit et sérieux dans le transport
reviews.reviewText: Courroie utilisée pour une paire de jumelles également achetée chez Amazon.Aucun problème. Je recherche la qualité, la solidité du produit et le sérieux dans son acheminement jusqu'à chez moi.Avec AMAZON que j'utilise depuis peu, c'est super !!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Good quality strap and doesn’t feel like it’s going to snap :)
